ygData.subject: Re: Disarm?
ygData.msgSnippet: That sounds silly, there must be more to it than that thou?  Lots of things in the game have seemed silly at first inspection, but a closer evaluation reveals
ygData.messageBody:
That sounds silly, there must be more to it than that thou? Lots of things
in the game have seemed silly at first inspection, but a closer evaluation
reveals there not (i.e. player made backpacks). Verant seems to like doing
stuff like that. Oh well I wont know until I get it.

But not being able to disarm magic items (thou it makes sense) does seem to
make the skill less than pointless. I dont know about you but at level 35 I
cant imagine fighting to many rusty and bronze using mobs.

Is it an automatic skill? or macro skill?

> ----------
> From: Jason Coan[SMTP:COANJ@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Wednesday, May 26, 1999 12:41 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Disarm?
>
> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
> It is a useless skill. When you disarm the weapon leaves their hand and
> lands on the ground for anybody to loot. You can only disarm non magic
> weapons. And monsters hit the same with or without a weapon, within 5
> points or so, so I don't really see a point in it.
>
> >>> "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...> 5.25.99 3:13:47 AM >>>
> From: "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...>
>
>
> O.K. now that the mystery of Riposte has been solved, what does
> disarm do EXACTLY.
>
> It flings the mobs weapon out of its hand?
>
> Is there a limitation, i.e. only non-magic weapons can be disarmed
> (if so its a silly skill).
>
> Thanks.
>
